      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Systems Programming Concepts",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I This course introduces students to a model of programming where the programming language exposes details of how the hardware stores and executes software. Building from the design concepts covered in CS 2102, this course covers manual memory management, pointers, the machine stack, and input\\ output mechanisms. The course will involve large-scale programming exercises and will be designed to help students confront issues of safe programming with system-level constructs. The course will cover several tools that assist programmers in these tasks. Students will be expected to design, implement, and debug programs in C++ and C. The course presents the material from CS 2301 at a fast pace and also includes C++ and other advanced topics. If a student does all 6 courses in a foreign language, they do not need to do a humanities seminar. Departments AR, EN/TH, MU, AB, CN, GN, SP, WR, RH, HI, HU, INTL, PY, RE",

      "Social Science": "2 courses from any department. Departments include ECON, ENV, GOV, PSY, SD, SOC, SS, STS, DEV, and ID2050. ID2050 must be taken unless the IQP is over 3 terms or the student takes an on-campus IQP.",

output: CS 2303: Systems Programming is a foundational course typically taken in your sophomore year (second year). Since it often serves as a prerequisite or recommended background for many upper-level courses (3000 and 4000 level), finishing it by the end of your sophomore year is highly recommended for timely progress.

instruction: Is taking CS 4804 and CS 3013 at the same time a reasonable course load for a D-term?
input:
{
  "courses_info": [
    {
      "code": "CS 4804",
      "normalized_code": "CS4804",
      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Data Visualization",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "CS4804 Data Visualization Cat.II. This course trains students in data visualization, the graphical communication of data and information for presentation, confirmation, and exploration. Students learn the stages of the visualization pipeline, including data characterization, mapping data attributes to graphical attributes, user task abstraction, visual display techniques, tools, paradigms, and perceptual issues. Students evaluate the effectiveness of visualizations for specific data, task, and user types. Students implement visualization algorithms and undertake projects involving the use of commercial and public-domain visualization tools. Recommended background: CS 2102 or CS 2103, and CS 2223.",

output: CS 4804 (Data Visualization) and CS 3013 (Operating Systems) are both demanding, project-heavy courses. Taking them simultaneously, even with just one other course (a standard load), would be challenging. It's not recommended to pair them unless you are comfortable with a very heavy workload in that term. Consider taking only one along with lighter general education requirements.

      "discipline": "ID",
      "description": "Cat. I This course is open to students accepted to off-campus IQP centers and programs . The course introduces students to research design, methods for social science research, and analysis . It also provides practice in specific research and field skills using the project topics students have selected in conjunction with sponsoring agencies . Students learn to develop social science hypotheses based upon literature reviews in their topic areas and apply concepts drawn from social psychology, anthropology, sociology, economics and other areas as appropriate . output: If you take ID 2050 (IQP Prep) in C-term, you would plan to complete your full-time IQP in D-term. Remember that during C-term, you cannot overload and take 4 classes while taking ID 2050.

instruction: What are the recommended background courses for CS 4731?
output: CS 4731: Computer Graphics typically recommends having a strong foundation in algorithms (CS 2223), linear algebra (MA 2071), and CS 2303 (Systems Programming) or an equivalent course that covers C/C++ programming.

instruction: Is CS 509 offered in the Fall or Spring semester?
output: CS 509: Design Of Software Systems is generally offered in the Fall (F) semester and Spring (S) semester. It is a core graduate course, so it usually runs every year in both semesters, but always check the official course schedule for the specific academic year.

      "title": "Introduction To Machine Organization And Assembly Language",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I This course introduces students to the structure and behavior of modern digital computers and the way they execute programs. Machine organization topics include the Von Neumann model of execution, functional organization of computer hardware, the memory hierarchy, caching performance, and pipelining. Assembly language topics include representations of numbers in computers, basic instruction sets, addressing modes, stacks and procedures, low-level I\\O, and the functions of compilers, assemblers, linkers, and loaders. The course also presents how code and data structures of higher-level languages are mapped into the assembly language and machine representations of a modern processor. Programming projects will be carried out in the C language and the assembly language of a modern processor. Recommended background: CS 2301 or CS 2303, or a significant knowledge of C\\C++.",

The course exposes students to all seven layers of OSI Reference Model while providing an introduction into newer topics such as wireless networking and Internet traffic concerns. The objective is to focus on an understanding of fundamental concepts of modern computer network architecture from a design and performance perspective. Topics covered include physical layer considerations, network protocols, wide area networks, local area networks, wireless networks, switches and routing, congestion, Internet traffic, and network security. instruction: What are the requirements for starting the HUA project?
output: To start your Humanities and Arts (HUA) project, you must first complete 5 HUA courses: 3 courses in your chosen 'depth' department, 1 course in a different 'breadth' department, and 1 additional HUA course from any department.

instruction: I'm a graduate student in Data Science. Is DS 4635 relevant to my degree?
output: DS 4635 is an undergraduate-level course (4000-level). While it might be relevant to your interests, it generally won't count as a core or elective course toward your MS in Data Science. You should be looking for 500-level courses (e.g., DS 501) or higher for graduate credit.

instruction: Is it possible to complete the MQP in one term instead of over multiple terms?
output: Yes, it is possible to complete the Major Qualifying Project (MQP) in one term. If you choose this path, the MQP is treated as equivalent to 3 or 4 classes for that term, meaning you would likely take only the MQP.

output: No, if you are taking the IQP preparation course ID 2050, you are not allowed to overload and take four classes in that term. The difficulty of ID 2050 requires a standard three-course load.

instruction: Is CS 4233 offered in C-term?
output: CS 4233: Object-Oriented Analysis And Design is typically offered in the C-term every year. Check the course history for the most accurate scheduling, but C-term is a reliable time for it.

instruction: I'm pursuing the BS+MS in CS. Do I need to take the IQP?
output: The BS portion of the BS+MS degree requires the successful completion of the Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP). You must complete it just like any other undergraduate student, generally before your final year of the combined program.

instruction: I am a graduate student. Is it reasonable to take 4 courses in one semester?
output: Graduate students typically take 3 courses per semester. Taking 4 graduate-level courses (an overload) is possible but very demanding. It's generally only reasonable if at least one of the courses is a lighter seminar or if you have a high comfort level with the material.

instruction: What are the prerequisites for DS 502?
output: DS 502: Statistical Methods for Data Science has prerequisites that include a strong background in probability and statistics, typically satisfied by courses like MA 517: Introductory Statistical Methods for Machine Learning and undergraduate coursework in statistics and linear algebra.

It also provides practice in specific research and field skills using the project topics students have selected in conjunction with sponsoring agencies . Students learn to develop social science hypotheses based upon literature reviews in their topic areas and apply concepts drawn from social psychology, anthropology, sociology, economics and other areas as appropriate . instruction: Is there a recommended background for CS 3733?

      "description": "Cat. I This course introduces the fundamental principles of software engineering. Modern software development techniques and life cycles are emphasized. instruction: Can I take CS 4000-level courses as an BS+MS in CS student for graduate credit?
output: Yes, you can often take 4000-level courses for graduate credit, usually referred to as '4000-level with graduate requirements.' This typically requires extra assignments, projects, or higher expectations to differentiate the graduate experience from the undergraduate one. The specific course must be approved for this option.

instruction: What is the HUA depth requirement for a BS in CS student?
output: The HUA 'depth' is not defined by your BS in CS major. It is your choice of an HUA department (e.g., Music, History, Literature) in which you take 3 courses and conduct your HUA project research.

output: CS 1101: Introduction to Program Design is a high-demand, entry-level course. It is generally offered in two undergraduate terms (A and C) to accommodate first-year students and others taking it later.

instruction: What is the difficulty of a one-term MQP?
output: A Major Qualifying Project (MQP) completed in one term is considered to be the difficulty equivalent of 3 or 4 standard courses. This is why students attempting a one-term MQP usually take no other courses concurrently.

instruction: When are 500-level courses offered for graduate students?
output: Graduate 500-level courses are generally offered in the Fall (F) and Spring (S) semesters. However, many introductory 500-level courses (like CS 501 or CS 502) may be offered in both semesters, while more specialized courses may only be offered once per year.

instruction: I'm a BS+MS student. Is my MQP different from a regular BS student's MQP?
output: While the project structure is similar, a BS+MS student's Major Qualifying Project (MQP) often has a higher expectation of depth and scope to potentially align with the thesis requirements or advanced research of a Master's degree. Discuss this with your advisor and MQP sponsor.

instruction: Do I need any background for CS 4120?
output: CS 4120: Analysis Of Algorithms has no formal prerequisites, but the recommended background is CS 2223 (Algorithms) as well as some knowledge of probability.

instruction: Can I take both CS 584 and CS 503 in the same semester?
output: Taking both CS 584 (Algorithms: Design And Analysis) and CS 503 (Foundations of Computer Science) in the same semester is very demanding as they are both core, theoretical, and challenging courses. While possible, it's generally advised to spread them out if possible.

instruction: What is the course number structure for undergraduate courses?
output: Undergraduate course numbers are structured as [2 to 4 letters] [4 digit integer]. The letters represent the department (e.g., CS, DS, MA) and the four digits denote the course level (1000-level is introductory, 4000-level is advanced undergraduate).

instruction: When should an MS in Data Science student consider completing a thesis versus a non-thesis option?
output: An MS in Data Science student should consider a thesis option if they are interested in advanced research or plan to pursue a Ph.D. The non-thesis option is better for those focused on a more coursework-intensive route to industry practice.

instruction: Is CS 4801 offered in B term?
output: CS 4801: Introduction to Cryptography and Communication Security is a popular elective that is generally offered in D-term. However, always check the official catalog for the specific year.

instruction: What is the course number structure for graduate courses?
output: Graduate course numbers are structured as [2 to 4 letters] [3 digit integer]. The letters represent the department (e.g., CS, DS) and the three digits denote the course level (e.g., 500-level is graduate, often 600-level for advanced topics/seminars).

instruction: What is the HUA breadth requirement?
output: The HUA 'breadth' requirement is one course taken in an HUA department that is different from the department you chose for your HUA 'depth' (where you take 3 courses).

instruction: Do I need to take the IQP if I'm getting a Master of Science in Computer Science?
output: No, the Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP) is a requirement for the undergraduate Bachelor of Science degree. Since the MS in Computer Science is a graduate-level degree, it does not require the IQP.

instruction: How many courses should an undergraduate student take per term?
output: WPI's standard undergraduate course load is 3 courses per term (A, B, C, and D term). Students have the option to 'overload' and take 4 courses in a term, but this is not required.

instruction: What is the difference between the BS in CS and the BS+MS in CS?
output: The BS in CS is a 4-year undergraduate degree. The BS+MS in CS is an accelerated program that typically takes 5 years and results in earning both the Bachelor of Science and the Master of Science degrees, often allowing for courses to count toward both degrees.

instruction: I need to take CS 4000-level courses for my degree. Which terms are best?
output: Advanced 4000-level courses are typically offered across all four terms (A, B, C, D). However, more niche electives may only run once or twice a year.

instruction: What does IQP stand for?
output: IQP stands for the Interactive Qualifying Project. It's a required research project for all WPI undergraduates that focuses on the interface between technology, science, and societal needs.

instruction: How long does it generally take to complete the Master of Science in Data Science degree?
output: The Master of Science (MS) in Data Science is generally completed in 2 years (four full semesters) for full-time students, though some students may take longer if they pursue a thesis or study part-time.

instruction: When should I start thinking about my MQP?
output: You should start thinking about your MQP (Major Qualifying Project) in your junior year (third year). This gives you time to find a project, secure a sponsor, and begin the planning phase, especially since many MQPs span multiple terms.

instruction: What's the difference between F semester and S semester for graduate students?
output: The F semester (Fall) runs from approximately late August to late December, and the S semester (Spring) runs from approximately January to May. These are the two primary terms for graduate course offerings.

instruction: In what order should a new MS in CS student take CS 584 and CS 503?
output: There is no specific order that students should take CS 584 (Algorithms: Design and Analysis) and CS 503 (Foundations of CS). However, Many students take 584 and 503 in separate semesters due to their heavy workload and theoretical nature.

instruction: I'm interested in the BS+MS in Data Science. How long is that program?
output: The Bachelor of Science and Master of Science (BS+MS) in Data Science combined degree program is generally designed to be completed in 5 years of full-time study.

instruction: How many courses are undergraduate students required to take for their degree?
output: WPI's undergraduate degrees require 45 courses worth of credits, but this includes the three major projects (HUA, IQP, MQP) and physical education courses. Only 37 of the these 45 courses are typical undergraduate courses.

instruction: What are the four terms in the undergraduate schedule?
output: The undergraduate schedule is broken down into four seven-week terms: A term, B term, C term, and D term.

instruction: What is the focus of the MQP?
output: The Major Qualifying Project (MQP) is a research project focused on applying the technical skills and knowledge gained in your specific major (e.g., Computer Science) to solve a complex problem.

instruction: Are there prerequisites for undergraduate courses?
output: WPI undergraduate courses generally have no formal prerequisites. However, they frequently have 'recommended background' courses that are strongly advised to be taken first, like CS 2303 for many upper-level courses.

instruction: What kind of project is the IQP?
output: The IQP (Interactive Qualifying Project) is a research project that integrates technical and social thinking, often addressing real-world problems in collaboration with groups and stakeholders outside of WPI's campus.

instruction: Is it required to take CS 4241 for a BS in CS?
output: CS 4241: Webware: Computational Technology For Network Information Systems is not a core required course for the BS in CS, but it is a popular option that counts as a technical elective.

instruction: Are there prerequisites for graduate courses?
output: Yes, unlike undergraduate courses, graduate courses often have formal prerequisites. These usually include specific foundational 500-level courses or a strong background in the topic's undergraduate equivalent.

instruction: What courses are recommended before taking MA 4644?

instruction: Is CS 4731 offered in the C term?

instruction: I'm interested in the BS in Data Science. What are the key projects I need to complete?
input:
{
  "degree_info": {
    "id": "BS_DS",
    "name": "BS Data Science",
    "found": true,
    "requirements": {
      "Humanities": "6 courses. 3 courses from the same department, then 1 from a different department, and then 1 more from any department. Finally humanities seminar. If a student does all 6 courses in a foreign language, they do not need to do a humanities seminar. Departments AR, EN/TH, MU, AB, CN, EN, GN, SP, WR, RH, HI, HU, INTL, PY, RE",
      "Wellness And Physical Education": "4 courses. Departments include WPE",
      "Social Science": "2 courses from any department. Departments include ECON, ENV, GOV, PSY, SD, SOC, SS, STS, DEV, and ID2050. ID2050 must be taken unless the IQP is over 3 terms or the student takes an on-campus IQP.",
      "The Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP)": "Either 1 term or 3. Can be completed off-campus or on-campus. Cannot be overloaded.",
      "Free Electives": "3 courses. Can be from any department.",
      "Data Science Core": "3 courses. Must take DS 1010, DS 2010, and DS 3010.",
      "Computer Science": "3 courses. Must take CS 2223. Two other courses must be chosen from CS 1004, CS 1101, CS 1102, CS 2102, CS 2103, CS 2119, or from CS electives listed in the course catalog.",
      "Mathematical Sciences": "5 courses. Must take MA 2611, MA 2612, and either MA 2071 or MA 2072. Two other courses must be chosen from MA 1020, MA 1021, MA 1022, MA 1120, or from MA electives listed in the catalog.",
      "Business Courses": "2 courses. Must take BUS 2080 or OIE 2081. One other course must be chosen from OBC 1010, ETR 1100, MIS 3010, or ETR 3633.",
      "Disciplinary Elective Courses": "11 courses. Electives must include at least 4/3 units (4 courses) at the 4000 level or higher and at least one course in each of the following categories: Databases (CS 3431, CS 4432, MIS 3720, CS 4433/DS 4433), Data mining/machine learning (CS 4445, CS 4342/DS 4342), Business modeling and prediction (MIS 4084, OIE 4430). DS 4099 counts as a disciplinary elective.",
      "Data Privacy and Ethics": "1 course.",
      "Science": "2 courses.",
      "MQP": "3 courses."
    }
  }
}
output: As a BS in Data Science student, you must complete the three major projects: the HUA (Humanities and Arts Project), the IQP (Interactive Qualifying Project), and the MQP (Major Qualifying Project).

instruction: How many HUA courses do I need in my depth department?

instruction: Is it reasonable to take CS 4404 and CS 4731 at the same time?
input:
{
  "courses_info": [

      "description": "Cat. I I This course introduces students to modern network security concepts, tools, and techniques. The course covers security threats, attacks, and mitigations at the operating-system and network levels (as opposed to the software level). Topics include authentication, authorization, confidentiality, integrity, anonymity, privacy, intrusion detection and response, and cryptographic applications. Students will become familiar with modern security protocols and tools. Assignments will involve using security-testing software to uncover vulnerabilities, network packet analyzers, and existing security applications to create secure network implementations. The course requires enough programming and systems background to understand attacks and use systems tools but does not involve significant programming projects. Assignments and projects will use a Linux base for implementation. Recommended Background: Knowledge of operating systems (CS 3013 or equivalent) and computer networks (CS 3516 or equivalent). Familiarity with Linux or Unix is essential.",

instruction: Is CS 548 a core course for the MS in DS?
output: CS 548: Knowledge Discovery And Data Mining is generally considered one of the core foundational courses for the Master of Science in Data Science degree, covering essential topics in extracting knowledge from data.

instruction: When can I take the HUA project?
output: You can take the HUA project any time after you have completed your 5 required HUA courses (3 depth, 1 breadth, 1 elective). Many students aim to finish it in their junior or senior year.

instruction: If I am doing the one-term IQP, am I allowed to take a 4th class?
output: No, if you are completing the IQP in one term (the full-time option), you are not allowed to take any additional classes in that term, as the project is the difficulty of 3 classes.

instruction: What are the terms for graduate students?
output: The graduate schedule is broken down into two terms (semesters): the F semester (Fall) and the S semester (Spring).

instruction: Is CS 584 relevant to the MS in Data Science degree?
output: Yes, CS 584 (Algorithms: Design And Analysis) is an excellent and relevant course for the MS in Data Science, especially for students focused on the efficiency and scalability of data-processing methods.

instruction: How many classes are typically taken by a graduate student per semester?
output: Graduate students generally take 3 courses per semester (F or S semester) to maintain full-time status and complete the degree in the standard time.

instruction: Is it possible to take DS 3010 and CS 4433 at the same time?
output: Yes, it is possible to take DS 3010 (Computational Methods) and CS 4433 (Big Data Management and Analytics) concurrently. They are both advanced electives, and while the load is high, there are no strong sequencing dependencies between them.

instruction: I'm a BS in CS student. What is the difficulty of the HUA project?
output: The Humanities and Arts (HUA) project is equivalent in difficulty to 1 class and is typically completed alongside two other classes in a standard three-course term.

instruction: I am interested in taking CS 525. Does it occur in the Spring semester?
output: CS 525 is a specialized course that is most often offered in the Spring (S) semester, but like all specialized electives, its offering term can change, so always check the official schedule.

Students will be expected to write and analyze programs. Undergraduate credit may not be earned both for this course and for CS 5084. Recommended background: Algorithms (CS 2223 or equivalent), and some knowledge of probability. This course will be offered in 2020-21, and in alternating years thereafter.",

instruction: What are the minimum requirements to start the MQP?
input:
{
  "degree_info": {
    "id": "BS_DS",
    "name": "BS Data Science",
    "found": true,
    "requirements": {
      "Humanities": "6 courses. 3 courses from the same department, then 1 from a different department, and then 1 more from any department. Finally humanities seminar. If a student does all 6 courses in a foreign language, they do not need to do a humanities seminar. Departments AR, EN/TH, MU, AB, CN, EN, GN, SP, WR, RH, HI, HU, INTL, PY, RE",
      "Wellness And Physical Education": "4 courses. Departments include WPE",
      "Social Science": "2 courses from any department. Departments include ECON, ENV, GOV, PSY, SD, SOC, SS, STS, DEV, and ID2050. ID2050 must be taken unless the IQP is over 3 terms or the student takes an on-campus IQP.",
      "The Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP)": "Either 1 term or 3. Can be completed off-campus or on-campus. Cannot be overloaded.",
      "Free Electives": "3 courses. Can be from any department.",
      "Data Science Core": "3 courses. Must take DS 1010, DS 2010, and DS 3010.",
      "Computer Science": "3 courses. Must take CS 2223. Two other courses must be chosen from CS 1004, CS 1101, CS 1102, CS 2102, CS 2103, CS 2119, or from CS electives listed in the course catalog.",
      "Mathematical Sciences": "5 courses. Must take MA 2611, MA 2612, and either MA 2071 or MA 2072. Two other courses must be chosen from MA 1020, MA 1021, MA 1022, MA 1120, or from MA electives listed in the catalog.",
      "Business Courses": "2 courses. Must take BUS 2080 or OIE 2081. One other course must be chosen from OBC 1010, ETR 1100, MIS 3010, or ETR 3633.",
      "Disciplinary Elective Courses": "11 courses. Electives must include at least 4/3 units (4 courses) at the 4000 level or higher and at least one course in each of the following categories: Databases (CS 3431, CS 4432, MIS 3720, CS 4433/DS 4433), Data mining/machine learning (CS 4445, CS 4342/DS 4342), Business modeling and prediction (MIS 4084, OIE 4430). DS 4099 counts as a disciplinary elective.",
      "Data Privacy and Ethics": "1 course.",
      "Science": "2 courses.",
      "MQP": "3 courses."
    }
  }
}
output: The minimum requirement to begin the Major Qualifying Project (MQP) is typically junior year standing and having completed most of the foundational 1000 and 2000-level courses for your major (Data Science).

instruction: What is the primary focus of the IQP?
output: The IQP's primary focus is on integrating technical thinking with social science problems to understand how technology impacts society and to propose solutions for real-world issues.

instruction: What are the project requirements for a BS in Computer Science?
output: The project requirements for a BS in Computer Science are the HUA project, the IQP (Interactive Qualifying Project), and the MQP (Major Qualifying Project).

instruction: What courses should I take before CS 4404?
input:
{

      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Tools And Techniques In Computer Network Security",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I I This course introduces students to modern network security concepts, tools, and techniques. The course covers security threats, attacks, and mitigations at the operating-system and network levels (as opposed to the software level). Topics include authentication, authorization, confidentiality, integrity, anonymity, privacy, intrusion detection and response, and cryptographic applications. Students will become familiar with modern security protocols and tools. Assignments will involve using security-testing software to uncover vulnerabilities, network packet analyzers, and existing security applications to create secure network implementations. The course requires enough programming and systems background to understand attacks and use systems tools but does not involve significant programming projects. Assignments and projects will use a Linux base for implementation. Recommended Background: Knowledge of operating systems (CS 3013 or equivalent) and computer networks (CS 3516 or equivalent). Familiarity with Linux or Unix is essential.",

instruction: I'm a BS+MS student. Can I take 500-level courses as an undergraduate?
output: Yes, one of the key benefits of the BS+MS program is the ability to take 500-level (graduate) courses during your undergraduate years, which can often be double-counted toward both your bachelor's and master's degrees.

The course exposes students to all seven layers of OSI Reference Model while providing an introduction into newer topics such as wireless networking and Internet traffic concerns. Topics covered include physical layer considerations, network protocols, wide area networks, local area networks, wireless networks, switches and routing, congestion, Internet traffic, and network security. instruction: Is CS 584 a prerequisite for MA 543?
output: CS 502 (Algorithms: Design And Analysis) is not a prerequisite for MA 543 (Statistical Methods for Machine Learning). MA 543 focuses more on statistical and probabilistic foundations than algorithmic complexity.

instruction: What is the HUA project focused on?
output: The HUA (Humanities and Arts) project is a research paper or practicum focused on a topic within your chosen HUA depth department.

instruction: What is the standard time to complete the BS in CS degree?
output: The standard time to complete the Bachelor of Science (BS) in Computer Science degree is 4 years (eight semesters/12 terms).

      "description": "Cat. I This course is open to students accepted to off-campus IQP centers and programs . The course introduces students to research design, methods for social science research, and analysis . It also provides practice in specific research and field skills using the project topics students have selected in conjunction with sponsoring agencies . Students learn to develop social science hypotheses based upon literature reviews in their topic areas and apply concepts drawn from social psychology, anthropology, sociology, economics and other areas as appropriate . Students make presentations, write an organized project proposal, and develop a communication model for reporting their project findings . Some sections of this course may be offered as Writing Intensive (WI).",

instruction: How many courses can a graduate student overload to take in one semester?
output: A graduate student can overload to take a maximum of 4 courses in one semester, though this is only recommended if they are confident in managing the heavy workload.

instruction: Is it reasonable to take CS 4342 and DS 4635 in the same term?
output: Taking CS 4342 (Machine Learning) and DS 4635 (Data Analytics And Statistical Learning) in the same term is redundant. They cover very similar material; you should take one or the other, or look into a 500-level alternative if you are in the BS+MS program.

instruction: What's the course ID for the IQP prep class?
output: The course ID for the required IQP preparation class, for students completing the IQP in one term, is ID 2050.

instruction: Is CS 503 offered in the Fall or Spring?
output: CS 503: Foundations of Computer Science is a core theoretical graduate course and is usually offered in the Spring (S) semester.

instruction: What is the typical time frame to complete the MS in Computer Science?
output: The typical time frame for a full-time student to complete the Master of Science (MS) in Computer Science is 2 years (four full semesters).

instruction: When does DS 2010 occur?
input:

      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Data Science II: Statistical Modeling and Analysis",
      "discipline": "DS",
      "description": "Cat. I, Units 1\\3. This course focuses on model- and data-driven approaches in Data Science. It covers methods from applied statistics, optimization, and machine learning to analyze and make predictions and inferences from real-world data sets. Topics covered in this course include a brief overview of statistics and linear algebra, followed by introductory machine learning methods such as linear and nonlinear regression, classification, decision trees, and dimension reduction techniques. Data exploration, data cleaning, feature engineering, and the bias-variance tradeoff will also be covered. Students will utilize various techniques and tools to explore and understand real-world data sets from various domains. Recommended Background Data science basics equivalent to DS 1010, applied statistics and regression equivalent to MA 2611 and MA 2612, and the ability to write computer programs in a scientific language equivalent to a CS programming course at the CS 1000 or CS 2000 level are assumed.",

      "description": "Cat. I This course is open to students accepted to off-campus IQP centers and programs . The course introduces students to research design, methods for social science research, and analysis . It also provides practice in specific research and field skills using the project topics students have selected in conjunction with sponsoring agencies . Students learn to develop social science hypotheses based upon literature reviews in their topic areas and apply concepts drawn from social psychology, anthropology, sociology, economics and other areas as appropriate . instruction: What is the HUA requirement for a student's breadth?
output: The HUA breadth requirement is one course from an HUA department different from your chosen HUA depth department.

instruction: Is CS 548 a prerequisite for DS 502?
output: No, CS 548 (Knowledge Discovery And Data Mining) is not a prerequisite for DS 502 (Statistical Methods For Data Science). In fact, a good understanding of statistics (DS 504) would be beneficial before taking Data Mining.

instruction: I'm a BS in Data Science student. Is it reasonable to take 4 classes during my C-term?
input:
{
  "degree_info": {
    "id": "BS_DS",
    "name": "BS Data Science",
    "found": true,
    "requirements": {
      "Humanities": "6 courses. 3 courses from the same department, then 1 from a different department, and then 1 more from any department. Finally humanities seminar. If a student does all 6 courses in a foreign language, they do not need to do a humanities seminar. Departments AR, EN/TH, MU, AB, CN, EN, GN, SP, WR, RH, HI, HU, INTL, PY, RE",
      "Wellness And Physical Education": "4 courses. Departments include WPE",
      "Social Science": "2 courses from any department. Departments include ECON, ENV, GOV, PSY, SD, SOC, SS, STS, DEV, and ID2050. ID2050 must be taken unless the IQP is over 3 terms or the student takes an on-campus IQP.",
      "The Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP)": "Either 1 term or 3. Can be completed off-campus or on-campus. Cannot be overloaded.",
      "Free Electives": "3 courses. Can be from any department.",
      "Data Science Core": "3 courses. Must take DS 1010, DS 2010, and DS 3010.",
      "Computer Science": "3 courses. Must take CS 2223. Two other courses must be chosen from CS 1004, CS 1101, CS 1102, CS 2102, CS 2103, CS 2119, or from CS electives listed in the course catalog.",
      "Mathematical Sciences": "5 courses. Must take MA 2611, MA 2612, and either MA 2071 or MA 2072. Two other courses must be chosen from MA 1020, MA 1021, MA 1022, MA 1120, or from MA electives listed in the catalog.",
      "Business Courses": "2 courses. Must take BUS 2080 or OIE 2081. One other course must be chosen from OBC 1010, ETR 1100, MIS 3010, or ETR 3633.",
      "Disciplinary Elective Courses": "11 courses. Electives must include at least 4/3 units (4 courses) at the 4000 level or higher and at least one course in each of the following categories: Databases (CS 3431, CS 4432, MIS 3720, CS 4433/DS 4433), Data mining/machine learning (CS 4445, CS 4342/DS 4342), Business modeling and prediction (MIS 4084, OIE 4430). DS 4099 counts as a disciplinary elective.",
      "Data Privacy and Ethics": "1 course.",
      "Science": "2 courses.",
      "MQP": "3 courses."
    }
  }
}
output: Yes, it is possible and reasonable for a WPI undergraduate to take 4 classes (overload) in C-term. However, you should evaluate the workload, especially if you have other project work (like the MQP or HUA) or if any of those 4 classes are known to be particularly demanding.

instruction: What is the focus of the IQP research?
output: The IQP research focuses on socially relevant, non-technical problems and the application of technical and critical thinking to address them.

instruction: I'm in the BS+MS in CS program. Do I need to complete the MQP?
output: Yes, you must complete the Major Qualifying Project (MQP) as it is a requirement for the Bachelor of Science portion of your combined degree. Your MQP will likely be more advanced to align with the MS track.

instruction: When should I take CS 2303?

      "title": "Systems Programming Concepts",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I This course introduces students to a model of programming where the programming language exposes details of how the hardware stores and executes software. Building from the design concepts covered in CS 2102, this course covers manual memory management, pointers, the machine stack, and input\\ output mechanisms. The course will involve large-scale programming exercises and will be designed to help students confront issues of safe programming with system-level constructs. The course will cover several tools that assist programmers in these tasks. Students will be expected to design, implement, and debug programs in C++ and C. The course presents the material from CS 2301 at a fast pace and also includes C++ and other advanced topics. Recommended background: CS 2102, CS 2103, or CS 2119 and\\or substantial object-oriented programming experience.",

instruction: Is it possible to complete the MQP in A-term?
output: Yes, it is possible to complete the one-term, intensive Major Qualifying Project (MQP) in A-term, provided you have a secured project and a committed sponsor.

instruction: I'm a MS in Data Science student. How many courses are required for my degree?
output: The MS in Data Science typically requires 10 courses (30 credits) for the non-thesis option, or 7 courses plus 9 thesis credits for the thesis option. Check the specific program handbook for details.

instruction: What is the general difficulty of the MQP?
output: The MQP (Major Qualifying Project) is the most substantial project, generally equivalent in difficulty to 3 or 4 courses, especially when completed in a single term.

instruction: Is CS 4516 offered in D-term?
input:
{
  "courses_info": [
    {
      "code": "CS 4516",
      "normalized_code": "CS4516",
      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Advanced Computer Networks",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I I This course provides an in-depth look into computer networks. While repeating some of the areas from CS 3516, the goal is to go deeper into computer networks topics. This in-depth treatment in topics such as routing, congestion control, wireless layer protocols, and physical signaling considerations will require the use of basic queuing theory and probability to provide a more formal treatment of computer networks performance. Other topics covered include LAN and WLAN technologies, mobile wireless networks, sensor networks, optical networks, network security, intrusion detection, and network management. Students will be expected to do more sophisticated network programming than seen in CS 3516 and will conduct laboratory activities involving measuring the performance of modern networking applications running on both wired networks and infrastructure wireless networks. Undergraduate credit may not be earned both for this course and for CS 513. Recommended background: CS 3013, CS 3516, and knowledge of probability. The course assumes a familiarity with operating systems including Unix or Linux and significant experience with C\\C++. This course will be offered in 2019-20, and in alternating years thereafter.",

instruction: What is the HUA requirement for a student's general elective?
output: The HUA general elective requirement is one additional HUA course that can be in any HUA department, including your depth or breadth department.

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it reasonable to take 2 courses in the Spring semester?
output: Taking 2 courses in the S (Spring) semester is reasonable but only for part-time enrollment. If you are a full-time student, you are expected to take 3 courses unless you are working on a thesis or have advisor approval to take a lighter load.

instruction: I'm in the BS+MS in CS. Can I finish in less than 5 years?
output: Finishing the BS+MS in CS in less than 5 years is extremely rare and would require a significant amount of credit coming into WPI (AP/transfer credits) and continuous overloading. It is designed as a 5-year program.

instruction: What is the undergraduate course number for the advanced algorithms course?
output: The undergraduate course number for the advanced algorithms course is typically CS 4120 (Analysis Of Algorithms) or similar, though the core algorithms is often covered in CS 2223.

instruction: What is the difference between a one-term and multi-term MQP?
output: A one-term MQP is an intensive, full-load project (3-4 courses worth). A multi-term MQP is completed over several terms (typically 2 or 3), with the workload spread out, allowing you to take other courses simultaneously.

instruction: How many HUA courses do I need in total?
output: You need to complete 5 HUA courses in total: 3 in your depth, 1 in your breadth, and 1 general HUA elective, before you can begin the HUA project.

instruction: What's the course ID for the graduate-level database course?
output: The course ID for the graduate-level database management course is typically CS 542 (Database Management Systems).

instruction: When should a BS in CS student take their IQP?
output: The IQP is typically completed during the junior year (third year), or sometimes during the following summer, during a single term off-campus.

instruction: What is the difference between A term and B term?
output: Both A term and B term are seven-week undergraduate terms (A term is the first half of the Fall semester, B term is the second half), and students typically take 3 courses in each.

instruction: Is the MQP required for the MS in CS degree?
output: No, the Major Qualifying Project (MQP) is a requirement for the undergraduate Bachelor of Science degree. It is not required for a standalone MS in Computer Science.

instruction: When is the MQP typically completed for a BS in CS student?
output: The MQP is generally completed in the senior year (fourth year), either spread over two or three terms, or in an intensive single term.

instruction: What is the undergraduate course number for the introductory programming course?
output: The main introductory programming course is CS 1101 (Introduction to Program Design).

instruction: I'm taking the multi-term IQP. How many classes can I take per term?
output: If you are taking the multi-term IQP (split over 3 terms), the IQP portion is equivalent to 1 class per term, so you would take 2 other classes for a standard load of 3 courses per term.

instruction: What is the MQP for a Data Science major typically focused on?
input:
{
  "degree_info": {
    "id": "BS_DS",
    "name": "BS Data Science",
    "found": true,
    "requirements": {
      "Humanities": "6 courses. 3 courses from the same department, then 1 from a different department, and then 1 more from any department. Finally humanities seminar. If a student does all 6 courses in a foreign language, they do not need to do a humanities seminar. Departments AR, EN/TH, MU, AB, CN, EN, GN, SP, WR, RH, HI, HU, INTL, PY, RE",
      "Wellness And Physical Education": "4 courses. Departments include WPE",
      "Social Science": "2 courses from any department. Departments include ECON, ENV, GOV, PSY, SD, SOC, SS, STS, DEV, and ID2050. ID2050 must be taken unless the IQP is over 3 terms or the student takes an on-campus IQP.",
      "The Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP)": "Either 1 term or 3. Can be completed off-campus or on-campus. Cannot be overloaded.",
      "Free Electives": "3 courses. Can be from any department.",
      "Data Science Core": "3 courses. Must take DS 1010, DS 2010, and DS 3010.",
      "Computer Science": "3 courses. Must take CS 2223. Two other courses must be chosen from CS 1004, CS 1101, CS 1102, CS 2102, CS 2103, CS 2119, or from CS electives listed in the course catalog.",
      "Mathematical Sciences": "5 courses. Must take MA 2611, MA 2612, and either MA 2071 or MA 2072. Two other courses must be chosen from MA 1020, MA 1021, MA 1022, MA 1120, or from MA electives listed in the catalog.",
      "Business Courses": "2 courses. Must take BUS 2080 or OIE 2081. One other course must be chosen from OBC 1010, ETR 1100, MIS 3010, or ETR 3633.",
      "Disciplinary Elective Courses": "11 courses. Electives must include at least 4/3 units (4 courses) at the 4000 level or higher and at least one course in each of the following categories: Databases (CS 3431, CS 4432, MIS 3720, CS 4433/DS 4433), Data mining/machine learning (CS 4445, CS 4342/DS 4342), Business modeling and prediction (MIS 4084, OIE 4430). DS 4099 counts as a disciplinary elective.",
      "Data Privacy and Ethics": "1 course.",
      "Science": "2 courses.",
      "MQP": "3 courses."
    }
  }
}
output: The MQP for a Data Science major is typically focused on applying advanced data analysis, statistical modeling, or machine learning techniques to a substantial, real-world data problem.

instruction: How long are the undergraduate terms (A, B, C, D)?
output: Each of the four undergraduate terms (A, B, C, and D) is approximately seven weeks long.

instruction: I'm a BS in CS student. Can I take more than one 4000-level course in a single term?
output: Yes, it is common and encouraged for BS in CS students in their junior/senior years to take two or even three 4000-level courses in a single term, provided you manage the cumulative project workload.

instruction: When is the best time to take the HUA project?
output: The best time to take the HUA project is typically in your sophomore or junior year, after you have completed all 5 of your preparatory HUA courses, often in a term with a lighter technical course load.

instruction: Is the MS in DS generally completed faster than the BS+MS in DS?
output: Yes, the standalone MS in Data Science is generally completed in 2 years, which is faster than the combined BS+MS in DS program that typically takes 5 years total.

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it reasonable to take 4 courses and work on a thesis in one semester?
output: No, taking 4 courses and working on a thesis simultaneously is extremely heavy and highly unreasonable. A thesis typically substitutes for 1-2 courses, so a more reasonable load would be 2-3 courses plus the thesis work.

instruction: What is the primary difference in course level between BS and MS in CS?
output: The BS focuses on 1000-4000 level courses, while the MS focuses on 500-level and higher graduate courses. The BS+MS combines both, allowing for an early start on the 500-level material.

instruction: What are the terms in the graduate academic schedule?
output: The graduate academic schedule is divided into the F (Fall) semester and the S (Spring) semester.

instruction: What is the HUA requirement that is in a different department?
output: The HUA requirement that is in a different department is the 'breadth' requirement, which is a single course in an HUA department separate from your 'depth'.

instruction: What is the typical time frame to complete the MS in Data Science?
output: The typical time frame for the Master of Science in Data Science is 2 years.

instruction: I'm a BS in CS major. Can I take a multiple-term MQP?
output: Yes, the Major Qualifying Project (MQP) is typically completed over multiple terms (usually 2 or 3) by BS in CS students, which is the less intensive option compared to the one-term MQP.

instruction: What is the undergraduate course number for the data structures and algorithms course?
output: The undergraduate course number for the core data structures and algorithms course is typically CS 2223 (Algorithms).

instruction: I'm a BS in CS major. Is it possible to take 4 classes during my C-term?
output: Yes, it is possible to overload and take 4 classes in C-term, provided you can handle the intensity of the compressed seven-week term and the overall project workload.

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it reasonable to take 4 courses in the S semester?
output: Yes, it is possible to overload and take 4 courses in the S (Spring) semester, but the workload is significantly increased from the standard 3-course load.

instruction: What is the undergraduate course number for the intro to data science course?
output: The undergraduate course number for the introductory data science course is DS 1010 (Introduction to Data Science).

instruction: What are the terms in the undergraduate academic schedule?
output: The undergraduate academic schedule is divided into four seven-week terms: A term, B term, C term, and D term.

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it reasonable to take 3 courses and work on a thesis in one semester?
output: No, taking 3 courses and working on a thesis (equivalent to 1-2 course units) is a very heavy and generally unadvised workload. A thesis typically replaces 1-2 course units for that semester.

instruction: What is the HUA requirement for a student's depth?
output: The HUA 'depth' requirement is 3 courses within a single Humanities and Arts department that you choose for your specialization.

instruction: I'm interested in the BS+MS in Data Science. Do I need to complete the IQP?
output: Yes, the Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP) is a requirement for the Bachelor of Science portion of the combined BS+MS in Data Science degree.

instruction: What is the undergraduate course number for the software engineering course?
output: The undergraduate course number for the software engineering course is CS 3733 (Software Engineering).

instruction: I'm a BS in CS major. Is it possible to take 4 classes and my HUA in the same term?
output: Yes, if you get permission from your advisor. Taking 4 classes and the HUA project (which is equivalent to 1 class) would be a load of 5 course units, which is a significant overload and highly discouraged due to the demanding nature of WPI's terms.

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it possible to take 4 courses in the F semester?
output: Yes, it is possible to overload and take 4 courses in the F (Fall) semester, but this is a very heavy workload and should only be considered if you have a strong academic record.

instruction: I'm a BS+MS student. When should I complete my IQP?
output: As a BS+MS student, you should complete your Interactive Qualifying Project (IQP) during your junior year (third year), just like a standard BS student, before starting the heavy graduate-level coursework.

instruction: I'm a BS in CS student. When should I take my MQP?
output: The Major Qualifying Project (MQP) should be completed during your senior year (fourth year). The most common plan is a multi-term MQP starting in A or B term of the senior year.

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it possible to complete a thesis for my degree?
output: Yes, both the MS in CS and MS in DS offer a thesis option, which requires fewer courses and the completion of a substantial research paper under a faculty advisor.

instruction: What is the MQP for a CS major typically focused on?
output: The MQP for a Computer Science major is typically focused on advanced application or research in a specialization area like security, AI, systems, or software engineering.

instruction: I'm interested in the BS in Computer Science. How long is that program?
output: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Computer Science program is generally completed in 4 years.

instruction: What are the terms in the undergraduate academic schedule?
output: The undergraduate academic schedule is divided into four seven-week terms: A term, B term, C term, and D term.

instruction: What is the undergraduate course number for the introductory machine learning course?
output: The undergraduate course number for the introductory machine learning course is typically CS 4342 (Machine Learning).

instruction: I'm a graduate student. Is it reasonable to take 3 courses in the Fall semester?
output: Yes, taking 3 courses in the Fall (F) semester is the standard, full-time course load and is perfectly reasonable for an MS in Data Science student.

instruction: When should I take CS 3516?
output: CS 3516: Computer Networks is best taken in your junior year (third year), as it requires foundational knowledge from 2000-level courses like CS 2303.

instruction: Is CS 4241 a prerequisite for any other course?
output: CS 4241 (Webware) is generally an end-of-sequence elective and is not a formal prerequisite for any other required CS courses. It serves as recommended background for advanced web/UI topics.

instruction: What are the recommended background courses for DS 548?
output: DS 548 (Knowledge Discovery And Data Mining) recommends a strong background in artificial intelligence, databases, and statistics, as well as a solid understanding of programming.

instruction: Is it possible to take CS 4801 and CS 4404 in the same term?
input:
{
  "courses_info": [
    {
      "code": "CS 4801",
      "normalized_code": "CS4801",
      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Introduction To Cryptography And Communication Security",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I This course provides an introduction to modern cryptography and communication security. It focuses on how cryptographic algorithms and protocols work and how to use them. The course covers the concepts of block ciphers and message authentication codes, public key encryption, digital signatures, and key establishment, as well as common examples and uses of such schemes, including the AES, RSA-OAEP, and the Digital Signature Algorithm. Basic cryptanalytic techniques and examples of practical security solutions are explored to understand how to design and evaluate modern security solutions. The course is suited for students interested in cryptography or other security related fields such as trusted computing, network and OS security, or general IT security. Recommended background: Experience in expressing algorithms in a modern programming language (e.g., ECE 2049 or CS 2301). Suggested background: Discrete mathematics (CS 2022\\MA 2201 or equivalent).",
      "keywords": [
        "introductory",
        "cryptography",
        "security",
        "ciphers"
      ],

      "title": "Tools And Techniques In Computer Network Security",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I I This course introduces students to modern network security concepts, tools, and techniques. The course covers security threats, attacks, and mitigations at the operating-system and network levels (as opposed to the software level). Topics include authentication, authorization, confidentiality, integrity, anonymity, privacy, intrusion detection and response, and cryptographic applications. Students will become familiar with modern security protocols and tools. Assignments will involve using security-testing software to uncover vulnerabilities, network packet analyzers, and existing security applications to create secure network implementations. The course requires enough programming and systems background to understand attacks and use systems tools but does not involve significant programming projects. Assignments and projects will use a Linux base for implementation. Recommended Background: Knowledge of operating systems (CS 3013 or equivalent) and computer networks (CS 3516 or equivalent). Familiarity with Linux or Unix is essential.",

instruction: Is MA 4644 offered in the A term?
output: MA 4644: Introduction to Time Series Analysis is a specialized elective that could be offered in A term, but is generally scheduled in D term.

instruction: I'm interested in the theory of computation. What course should I take after CS 3133?
output: After CS 3133 (Foundations of CS), a student interested in theory should consider CS 4120 (Analysis Of Algorithms) or relevant 500-level courses like CS 503 (Foundations of CS) if in the BS+MS program.

instruction: Is CS 4801 a required course for the BS in CS?
output: No, CS 4801 (Cryptography and Security) is an elective and is not a core required course for the Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.

instruction: Is there a course that combines CS and DS topics?
output: Courses like CS 4342 (Machine Learning) and DS 4635 (Statistical Learning) are excellent examples of courses that heavily combine Computer Science and Data Science topics.

instruction: What courses are recommended before taking CS 503?
output: CS 503 (Foundations of CS) is a highly theoretical course that recommends a very strong background in discrete mathematics, algorithms, and writing proofs.

instruction: Is it reasonable to take CS 548 and CS 585 in the same semester?
output: Yes, taking CS 548 (Data Mining) and CS 585 (Big Data Management) in the same semester is reasonable for a full-time MS in DS student. Both are data-focused and complement each other.

instruction: Is CS 4433 a good course for a BS in CS student interested in distributed systems?
output: Yes, CS 4433 (Big Data Management) covers distributed frameworks (like Hadoop/Spark) and is an excellent elective for a BS in CS student interested in large-scale distributed systems and computing.

instruction: Is CS 4731 offered in C-term?
output: CS 4731: Computer Graphics is a highly popular elective that is generally offered in the C-term every year.

instruction: How many courses should a first-year BS in CS student take in A-term?
output: A first-year BS in CS student should take the standard load of 3 courses in A-term. Overloading is not recommended in the first term as you adjust to WPI's fast-paced seven-week schedule.

instruction: What course should I take if I am interested in cybersecurity?
output: You should start with foundational systems courses like CS 2303 (Systems Programming) and CS 3013 (Operating Systems), then move on to specialized electives like CS 4801 (Cryptography) and CS 4404 (Network Security).

instruction: What courses should I take before CS 4404?
input:
{
  "courses_info": [
    {
      "code": "CS 4404",
      "normalized_code": "CS4404",
      "level": "Undergraduate",
      "title": "Tools And Techniques In Computer Network Security",
      "discipline": "CS",
      "description": "Cat. I I This course introduces students to modern network security concepts, tools, and techniques. The course covers security threats, attacks, and mitigations at the operating-system and network levels (as opposed to the software level). Topics include authentication, authorization, confidentiality, integrity, anonymity, privacy, intrusion detection and response, and cryptographic applications. Students will become familiar with modern security protocols and tools. Assignments will involve using security-testing software to uncover vulnerabilities, network packet analyzers, and existing security applications to create secure network implementations. The course requires enough programming and systems background to understand attacks and use systems tools but does not involve significant programming projects. Assignments and projects will use a Linux base for implementation. Recommended Background: Knowledge of operating systems (CS 3013 or equivalent) and computer networks (CS 3516 or equivalent). Familiarity with Linux or Unix is essential.",
      "keywords": [
        "introductory",
        "security",
        "authentication",
        "authorization",
        "confidentiality",

instruction: What is the difficulty of a multi-term MQP per term?
